meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>roast</kanji>, and the verb version is <vocabulary>to roast</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to toast</vocabulary>. This verb is most commonly used when referring to dry roasting things like coffee, tea, or beans.
readingMnemonic: Do you know what animal likes <vocabulary>to roast</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to toast</vocabulary> things? <reading>Ea</reading>gles (い)! They're always roasting coffee beans and the like. That's how they stay so alert.
